definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)

sentences.english: Chapter Two researches on the exertion of subrogation right of marine insurance.
sentences.chinese: 第二章探讨海上保险代位求偿权的行使。

sentences.english: Chapter 3 discusses the legal protection of the insurance subrogation right.
sentences.chinese: 第三章保险代位求偿权的法律保护。

sentences.english: Financial assets are simply a claim on goods and services.
sentences.chinese: 金融资产简言之即对产品和服务的求偿权。

sentences.english: The surety who pays the principal obligation is subrogated to the rights of the creditor.
sentences.chinese: 履行主债务的保证人取得代位求偿权。

sentences.english: Chapter two studies the establishment and acquisition of the rights of subrogation in insurance.
sentences.chinese: 第二章保险代位求偿权的成立与取得。

sentences.english: Although this kind of claim pattern has its rationalities, it also has many disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种求偿模式虽有其合理性，但也存在诸多弊端。

sentences.english: In chapter 6, we study the Subrogation of Marine Transport cargo Insurance.
sentences.chinese: 第六章研究的是保险代位求偿权。

sentences.english: In the first paragraph, the civil law foundation of subrogation is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 在第一章中，分析了代位求偿权的民法基础。

sentences.english: Regarding the nature of the right of recourse, the Subjective Joint Relation Theory should be adopted.
sentences.chinese: 求偿权的性质应采纳主观共同关系说。

sentences.english: Chapter four studies the protection of subrogation.
sentences.chinese: 第四章保险代位求偿权的保护。

sentences.english: The right of subrogation is an important statutory right of underwriter in maritime insurance.
sentences.chinese: 代位求偿权是海上保险中保险人的一项重要法定权利。

definition: to judge a case/to render a verdict/verdict
another case (in law)/a case to treat separately
to refuse to accept a payment/to refuse to pay/to stop (a check or payment)
to apply to a court for an arrest warrant
variant of 巨額|巨额[ju4 e2]
